name: Bran Castle
description: Medieval castle associated with the legend of Dracula, built in 1377.

name: Bucharest - Palace of Parliament
description: The second-largest administrative building in the world, after the Pentagon.

name: Mamaia
description: The most popular seaside resort in Romania, with fine sand and nightlife.

name: Alba Iulia - Alba Carolina Citadel
description: The largest Vauban-style citadel in Romania, where the Great Union of 1918 was proclaimed.

name: Peleș Castle
description: Summer castle of the royal family, a masterpiece of Neo-Renaissance architecture.

name: Sighișoara - Historical Center
description: The best-preserved inhabited medieval citadel in Europe, a UNESCO heritage site.

name: Danube Delta
description: The second-largest delta in Europe, a UNESCO biosphere reserve.

name: Turda Salt Mine
description: A salt mine transformed into an underground amusement park, with lakes and a Ferris wheel.

name: Voroneț Monastery
description: Famous for the 'Blue of Voroneț', one of the painted monasteries of Moldova.

name: Transfăgărășan
description: The most spectacular road in Romania, named 'the best road in the world' by Top Gear.

name: Râșnov Citadel
description: 13th-century peasant citadel with panoramic views of the mountains.

name: Vama Veche
description: Bohemian beach known for its free atmosphere and camping culture.

name: Corvin Castle
description: One of the largest castles in Europe, a Gothic-Renaissance masterpiece.

name: Putna Monastery
description: Monastery founded by Stephen the Great, considered the 'Jerusalem of the Romanian people'.

name: Bicaz Gorge
description: The most impressive gorge in Romania, with vertical walls up to 300m.

name: Sibiu - Historical Center
description: A European Capital of Culture with well-preserved medieval architecture.

name: Timișoara - Union Square
description: The city where the 1989 Revolution began, known for its beautiful architecture.

name: Horezu Monastery
description: A monastery in the Brâncovenesc style, a UNESCO heritage site for its unique architecture.

name: Sinaia - Mountain Resort
description: Beautiful mountain resort known as the 'Pearl of the Carpathians'.

name: Poenari Citadel
description: The authentic fortress of Vlad the Impaler, accessible after climbing 1,480 steps.

name: Băile Herculane
description: A 2,000-year-old spa resort, founded by the Romans.

name: Piatra Craiului
description: Mountain range with spectacular ridges, a paradise for hiking and climbing.

name: Curtea de Argeș Monastery
description: Princely monastery with unique architecture, burial place of Romania's kings.

name: Târgu Jiu
description: The city of the 'Heroes' Path' Sculptural Ensemble created by Constantin Brâncuși.

name: Lake Sfânta Ana (Saint Anne)
description: The only volcanic lake in Romania, located in the crater of an extinct volcano.

name: Deva - The Citadel
description: Medieval fortress located on a volcanic hill, accessible by cable car.

name: Cozia Monastery
description: Medieval monastery with Byzantine architecture, founded by Mircea the Elder.

name: Bucharest - Old Town
description: The historical heart of the capital with pedestrian streets, restaurants, and old buildings.

name: Nera Gorge
description: The Nera-Beușnița Gorges National Park with spectacular waterfalls and caves.

name: Bánffy Castle
description: Baroque castle in Bonțida, known as the 'Versailles of Transylvania'.

name: Arbore Monastery
description: Painted monastery in Bucovina, a UNESCO heritage site for its exterior frescoes.

name: Praid Salt Mine
description: Salt mine with one of the largest salt reserves in Europe and underground lakes.

name: Făgăraș Citadel
description: Medieval fortress turned into a museum, one of the best-preserved in the country.

name: Sâmbăta de Sus Monastery
description: Brâncovenesc monastery in the heart of the Făgăraș Mountains, known as the 'White Monastery'.

name: Bâlea Lake
description: Glacial lake at 2,034m altitude, a starting point for hikes in the Făgăraș.

name: Miercurea Ciuc - Mikó Castle
description: Renaissance castle in Miercurea Ciuc, headquarters of the Szekler Museum.

name: Tismana Monastery
description: The oldest monastery in Wallachia, founded by Nicodim of Tismana.

name: Sarmizegetusa Regia
description: The ancient capital of Dacia, a Dacian fortress in the Orăștie Mountains, UNESCO heritage.

name: Vidraru Lake
description: Impressive reservoir lake with its 166-meter high dam.

name: Neamț Citadel
description: Medieval fortress in Moldova, with an important role in defending against the Ottomans.

name: Agapia Monastery
description: Nunnery with frescoes painted by Nicolae Grigorescu.

name: Turda Gorge
description: Nature reserve with vertical walls up to 300m, a paradise for climbing.

name: Sturdza Castle
description: Neo-Gothic castle in Miclăușeni, known for its fairytale architecture.

name: Dragomirna Monastery
description: Monastery with unique Moldavian style architecture, known for its stone lacework.

name: Letea Forest
description: The northernmost subtropical forest in Europe, located in the Danube Delta.

name: Suceava - The Seat Citadel
description: Medieval fortress that was the main defensive fortress of Moldova.

name: Secu Monastery
description: Monastery and hermitage in a cave, one of the oldest monastic settlements in Moldova.

name: Carei - Karolyi Castle
description: Neo-Renaissance castle in Carei, former residence of the Károlyi family.

name: Sucevița Monastery
description: Fortified monastery with its complete frescoes, the last painted monastery in Bucovina.

name: Merry Cemetery
description: A unique cemetery in the world, famous for its brightly colored grave crosses and poetic epitaphs.

name: Bârsana Monastery
description: Wooden monastery complex, representative of the traditional Maramureș architecture, part of UNESCO heritage.

name: Danube Gorges (Cazanele)
description: Spectacular section of the Danube gorge, where the river narrows between rock walls.

name: Decebalus Statue
description: The largest rock sculpture in Europe, representing the Dacian king Decebalus.

name: Oradea
description: City with impressive, recently restored Art Nouveau (Secession) architecture.

name: Bears' Cave
description: Cave famous for its cave bear fossils and spectacular formations.

name: Vaser Valley Steam Train (Mocănița)
description: The last steam-powered forestry railway in Europe, offering a picturesque journey through the mountains.

name: Brașov - The Black Church
description: The largest Gothic church in Southeastern Europe, a symbol of the city of Brașov.

name: Muddy Volcanoes
description: A unique nature reserve in Europe, with miniature volcanoes erupting mud and natural gas.

name: Sphinx and Babele
description: Spectacular rock formations on the Bucegi plateau, formed by wind erosion.

name: Cantacuzino Castle
description: Neo-Romanian style castle built in 1911, with a superb panorama of the Bucegi Mountains.

name: Retezat National Park
description: National park with over 80 glacial lakes and rich biodiversity.

name: Densuș Church
description: One of the oldest churches in Romania, built from Roman materials, with an unusual architecture.

name: Ulpia Traiana Sarmizegetusa
description: The capital of the Roman province of Dacia, with ruins of an amphitheater, temples, and forum.

name: Transalpina
description: The highest road in Romania, crossing the Parâng Mountains and offering stunning alpine landscapes.

name: Scărișoara Ice Cave
description: It houses the largest underground glacier in Romania, over 3000 years old.

name: Viscri
description: Picturesque Saxon village with an impressive fortified church, part of the UNESCO heritage.

name: Rupea Citadel
description: Impressive medieval fortress built on a basalt massif, recently restored.

name: Iași - Palace of Culture
description: Emblematic Neo-Gothic building, home to 4 museums (the 'Moldova' National Museum Complex).

name: Neamț Monastery
description: The oldest and largest monastery for monks in Moldova, an important cultural and spiritual center.

name: Cluj-Napoca - City Center
description: The heart of Transylvania, a vibrant city with a Gothic central square and an active nightlife.

name: Cluj-Napoca - Botanical Garden
description: One of the largest and most beautiful botanical gardens in Southeastern Europe.

name: Sibiu - Brukenthal National Museum
description: The oldest museum in Romania, located in a Baroque palace, with an impressive collection of European art.

name: Sibiu - ASTRA Museum
description: One of the largest open-air museums in Europe, dedicated to traditional folk civilization.

name: Brașov - Old Town
description: Picturesque medieval city at the foothills of Tâmpa Mountain, with Saxon architecture and a vibrant atmosphere.

name: Băile Felix
description: The largest permanent spa resort in Romania, famous for its thermal waters.

name: Mărășești Mausoleum
description: Impressive monument dedicated to the Romanian heroes who fell in World War I.

name: Târgoviște - Princely Court
description: Former capital of Wallachia and residence of Vlad the Impaler; includes the Chindia Tower.

name: Bucharest - Romanian Athenaeum
description: Emblematic concert hall and architectural monument, a symbol of Romanian culture.

name: Bucharest - 'Dimitrie Gusti' Village Museum
description: Open-air ethnographic museum, located in Herăstrău Park, with traditional houses from all over the country.

name: Mogoșoaia Palace
description: Brâncovenesc style palace located on the lake shore, an important cultural center.

name: Prislop Monastery
description: Important Orthodox pilgrimage site, home to the tomb of Father Arsenie Boca.

name: Roșia Montană
description: Historic mining town with ancient Roman galleries, recently included in the UNESCO heritage.

name: Peștera Muierilor (Women's Cave)
description: The first electrified cave in Romania, with spectacular galleries and cave bear remains.

name: Enisala Citadel
description: The only surviving medieval fortress in Dobrogea, overlooking Lake Razim.

name: Horses' Waterfall
description: The largest waterfall in Romania, with a drop of over 90 meters in the Rodna Mountains.

name: Histria Citadel
description: The oldest attested urban settlement on Romanian territory, founded by Greek colonists.

name: Constanța - The Casino
description: Emblematic Art Nouveau building on the Black Sea promenade, currently under restoration.

name: Constanța - Carol I Mosque
description: The main Muslim place of worship in Romania, with a 47m high minaret offering a panorama of the city.

name: Sâmbăta de Jos Stud Farm
description: One of the most important stud farms in the country, specializing in breeding Lipizzaner horses.

name: Tihuța Pass
description: Pass in the Bârgău Mountains, connecting Transylvania to Bucovina, famous due to the novel 'Dracula'.

name: Wooden Churches of Maramureș
description: Eight remarkable wooden churches, included in the UNESCO heritage, famous for their high towers and wood carvings.

name: Feldioara Citadel
description: The most important fortress of the Teutonic Knights in Țara Bârsei, completely restored.

name: Ialomiței Cave
description: Impressive cave in the Bucegi Mountains, with a monastery at the entrance and galleries arranged for visiting.

name: Târgu Neamț - Ion Creangă Memorial House
description: The birthplace of the great storyteller Ion Creangă, a memorial museum that preserves the atmosphere of his childhood.

name: Bucharest - Arch of Triumph
description: Monument dedicated to Romania's victory in World War I and the Great Union of 1918.

name: Cernica Monastery
description: Important monastery complex near Bucharest, located on an island on Lake Cernica.

name: Călimani National Park
description: The largest volcanic massif in Romania, with unique landscapes and the '12 Apostles' reserve.

name: Borsec Resort
description: Spa resort renowned for its sparkling mineral waters with curative properties.

name: Iași - Botanical Garden
description: The oldest and largest botanical garden in Romania, with an impressive collection of plants.

name: Craiova - Historical Center
description: The capital of Oltenia, known for its parks, museums, and Brâncuși's early works.

name: Galați - Danube Promenade
description: The largest Romanian port on the Danube, famous for its long riverside promenade.

name: Ploiești - Clock Museum
description: An important industrial city, home to the unique 'Nicolae Simache' Clock Museum.

name: Brăila - Historical Center
description: Historic Danube port city with a well-preserved 19th-century center and radial street plan.

name: Arad - City Center
description: Major city in western Romania with impressive architecture on the banks of the Mureș River.

name: Pitești - City Center
description: Known as the 'City of Tulips', Pitești is an important commercial center.

name: Bacău - City Center
description: A major city in Moldova, known for its large parks and cultural life.

name: Târgu Mureș - Palace of Culture
description: A multicultural city known for its beautiful Secession-style Palace of Culture.

name: Baia Mare - Liberty Square
description: The capital of Maramureș, with a historic center centered around Liberty Square and Stephen's Tower.

name: Râmnicu Vâlcea - City Center
description: City on the Olt River, a gateway to nearby monasteries and the Transalpina road.

name: Drobeta-Turnu Severin - Trajan's Bridge Ruins
description: Port city on the Danube, home to the ruins of Trajan's Bridge and the Iron Gates Museum.

name: Satu Mare - New City Center
description: City in northwestern Romania with a mix of historical and modernist architecture.

name: Costinești
description: The 'Youth Resort', famous for its vibrant nightlife, the Obelisk, and the shipwreck.

name: Eforie Nord
description: Large spa resort on the Black Sea, known for Techirghiol mud treatments and its wide beach.

name: Neptun-Olimp
description: Twin resorts known for their lush vegetation, elegant hotels, and a more relaxed atmosphere.

name: Alexandria - City Center
description: The county seat of Teleorman, a commercial and administrative center in the Wallachian Plain.

name: Bistrița - Medieval Center
description: Historic city in Transylvania with a well-preserved medieval center and a landmark Evangelical church.

name: Botoșani - Old Center
description: The city of Mihai Eminescu, with a historic center featuring 19th-century architecture and memorial houses.

name: Buzău - City Center
description: Gateway to the Muddy Volcanoes and the Buzău Mountains, with a central park and the Communal Palace.

name: Călărași - Danube Park
description: Danube port city with a large central park and a river branch (Borcea) ideal for recreation.

name: Focșani - Union Square
description: The 'City of the Union', located on the Milcov River, which once separated Wallachia and Moldova. Features a Union monument.

name: Giurgiu - Clock Tower
description: Main border crossing to Bulgaria via the Friendship Bridge. Its symbol is the old Clock Tower.

name: Piatra Neamț - City Center
description: Known as the 'Pearl of Moldova' for its picturesque setting in the Eastern Carpathians, with a cable car to Pietricica Hill.

name: Reșița - City Center
description: An important industrial center in the Banat region, known for its steelworks and the Open-Air Steam Locomotive Museum.

name: Sfântu Gheorghe - City Center
description: The capital of Covasna County, a center of Szekler culture with a distinct Hungarian architectural influence.

name: Slatina - City Center
description: A historic city on the Olt River, known as the birthplace of playwright Eugène Ionesco.

name: Slobozia - City Center
description: The capital of Ialomița County, known for the nearby Amara Lake and a replica of the Eiffel Tower.

name: Vaslui - Stephen the Great's Princely Court
description: Historic city where Stephen the Great won a major victory (Battle of Vaslui). Features a Princely Court and church.
highlights: Princely Court of Stephen the Great

name: Zalău - City Center
description: The capital of Sălaj County, located near the Apuseni Mountains. Site of the ancient Porolissum Dacian fortress.

name: Comana National Park
description: A vast wetland area known as the 'Delta near Bucharest', ideal for birdwatching and boat trips.

name: Bellu Manor
description: Beautifully restored manor in Urlați, a museum showcasing the lifestyle of Romanian rural nobility.

name: Dealu Monastery
description: Historic monastery near Târgoviște, notable as the burial place of Michael the Brave's head.
highlights: Tomb of Michael the Brave's head

name: Slănic Salt Mine
description: One of the largest salt mines in Europe, with huge underground chambers used for recreation and respiratory treatments.

name: Constanța - Old Town (Piața Ovidiu)
description: The oldest continuously inhabited city in Romania, a major port with a historic center, casino, and beaches.

name: Mangalia - Tourist Port
description: Ancient city (Callatis) and modern spa resort, known for its tourist port, sandy beaches, and sulfidic thermal waters.

name: Poiana Brașov
description: The most famous and largest ski resort in Romania, located near Brașov, with extensive slopes and modern facilities.

name: Sinaia - Cota 2000
description: High-altitude ski resort in the Bucegi Mountains, offering the best high-altitude slopes in the country.

name: Predeal
description: The highest town in Romania, a traditional ski resort on the Prahova Valley with slopes for all levels.

name: Bușteni - Kalinderu
description: Resort at the base of the Bucegi Mountains, known for the modern Kalinderu slopes and fun park.

name: Azuga
description: Ski resort on the Prahova Valley, home to the longest homologated ski slope in Romania, Sorica.

name: Straja
description: Popular ski resort in the Vâlcan Mountains, with numerous slopes, gondola access, and a lively atmosphere.

name: Păltiniș
description: The oldest ski resort in Romania, located in the Cindrel Mountains, near Sibiu, offering a quiet, family-friendly vibe.

name: Rânca
description: High-altitude resort located on the Transalpina road, known for its long snow season and beautiful views.

name: Cavnic
description: Ski resort in Maramureș known for reliable snow cover and diverse slopes, including Roata and Icoana.

name: Vatra Dornei
description: Spa and ski resort in Bucovina, offering gentle slopes ideal for beginners and a scenic chairlift.

name: Borșa
description: Resort in the Rodna Mountains, famous for its long Olympic slope and access to Horses' Waterfall.

name: Parâng
description: High-altitude resort in the Parâng Mountains, accessible by chairlift from Petroșani, offering spectacular views.

name: Muntele Mic
description: Resort in the Banat Mountains, known for its good snow and beautiful scenery, accessible by a new gondola.

name: Transalpina Ski Resort (Vidra)
description: One of the newest and most modern ski resorts, located near Lake Vidra, with a high-speed gondola and stunning views.

name: Harghita-Băi
description: Ski and spa resort in the Harghita Mountains, known for its kaolin mine and family-friendly slopes.
